page.title: 15 HOUSING
page.content: Within this area are found mainly individual, detached owner occupied accommodation, with just a few rented houses mainly from land owners such as Harnage Grange. The houses were found along the roads in the two villages of Kenley and Harley on the recent ribbon development pattern. Other homesteads were scattered in isolated outreaches and aptly named such as 'Stone House' and 'Broomcroft'. These were of sandstone and modern brick but thatched cottages with leaded windows are seen as are buildings of wattle and daub. There is no slum clearance within the area but old buildings are found which are certainly in need of renovation. An example of this is the wattle and daub barn to be found opposite St. Mary's Church in Harley.
